comment: He's very caring and want to make sure you understand before moving on. Bring alot to the table for understanding Great Professor, hate our class ended.

There are few comments about him being the worse teacher or don't take him, he is rude. He start the classroom really hard, and you may want to quit right after the first day/week; you will regret it if you drop his class, he is actually a cool professor. He is not hard, he just want you to learn and retain something from his class when you leave.

Great professor. People will tell you not to take him because he seems so mean at the beginning but stick with it! He has a soft spot for students who actually care about their grade & the topic! Don't really use book but have it just in case he makes you read and will surprise you with pop quiz's! My advice take him! buy the book! and go to class

Comes across strong in the beginning but really he is pretty laid back. Learned quite a bit in his class, and I wouldn't mind having him for TOSS. He knows his stuff and really makes you think about topics in a way you may have not before. I never talk in classes but he helped me feel more comfortable talking.

He is a great teacher and very helpful. People think he is rude when he is actually just doing what is best for his students. He will help you when you ask and he will praise you when you do well. I would take his class again in a heartbeat. It is not hard. All he wants it some respect while teaching which is not a lot to ask! WONDERFUL TEACHER! :)
He is very strict and expects a lot. I really enjoyed his class though! He loves class discussion. The work was hard but worth it in the long run.

i don't know why some people think he's rude, he probably just called them out for texting or sleeping (which is rude on the student's part, not his). that being said, he's a very knowledgable professor who is really passionate for his subject. no test, just papers and essays and he grades easy. nice guy.

I do not like him at all. He is rude and not compassionate towards students. His whole class is discussion. I'm not learning much at all. I'm payin for him to teach me and I feel like my money isn't being put to use as well as it should be. He is strict and forces people to talk in class. If you don't talk, it's awkward and he stares. Bad teacher.

He grades relatively easy and there are no tests, mostly just lesson plans (the majority being groupwork).He's NOT rude, but he will call you out if you are doing something you're not supposed to do,  texting, sleeping, etc. If I were a professor I would be upset if my students were doing that too. he tells good stories and you actually learn stuff

Dr. Bantwini has a heart for education.  He may seem intimidating the first day, but stick with it!  You will actually learn something in this education class.  He gives great feedback on lesson plans and allows you to correct mistakes for a better grade.  Mainly group work.  LOTS of discussions.  No reading quizzes.  I will take him again for sure

Great Professor and he is not rude!  He is very intelligent and though he may come across tough on the first day, he is really nice.  He gives you his best and expects the best from you in return.  Be prepared for class and you will be fine.

A lot of the class is discussion based so make sure you participate! He gives great feedback on lesson plans but sometimes he does grade a little hard. I would recommend him, you will learn, and he is nice no matter how he comes across the first day :)

The first day of class I admittedly was worried-he was VERY strict in setting the class rules and guidelines.I always watch to see how my profs use classroom mgmt skills since I am one day going 2 have 2 do the same. I wondered if his approach would work-it did.I learned so much from the class discussions Bantwini facilitated. The man is brilliant.

Boring, boring, boring.  I had him for curriculum and assessment and I dreaded going to class.  Although his class was super easy, I would not take him again.  Although other people have said he is rude I don't think he is.  He just has his rules and if you don't follow them he will call you out.

Avoid if possible! He does not explain or really teach anything. He wants you to read the text book and has you write summaries on the chapters, which is not graded. I do not feel like I learned anything from his class.

He is really rude. He doesn't like to hear the opinions of students because apparently we are in someway beneath him. Not a good professor for an such a pointless class. Requires text summaries (not graded). He called out this chick in class for sleeping (he is rather boring) and claimed she was disrupting the class when it was really his fussing.
